metadata.title: YouTube Equipment Starter Kit 2025: Beginner Creator Essentials
metadata.description: Essential YouTube starter kit. Must-have equipment for new creators at every budget.

hero.headline: YouTube Equipment Starter Kit
hero.subheadline: Essential gear for new creators. Start with what matters, upgrade later.

sections.content: Starting YouTube doesn't require thousands in equipment. In fact, many successful creators started with just a phone. The key is knowing what actually matters for video quality and what can wait. Here's your essential starter kit at every budget level.

content.title: Smartphone Camera
content.description: Modern phones have excellent cameras. Better than many webcams.

content.title: Natural Light
content.description: Face a window. Free, beautiful lighting. Best light available.

content.title: DaVinci Resolve
content.description: Free professional editing. More power than most need.

content.title: USB Microphone (~$50)
content.description: Fifine K669B or similar. Biggest quality upgrade available.

content.title: Ring Light (~$30)
content.description: Basic ring light with stand. Consistent face lighting.

content.title: Phone Tripod (~$20)
content.description: Stable shots. Hands-free filming. Essential stability.

content.title: Canon/Sony Camera (~$300)
content.description: Sony ZV-E10 or Canon M50. Creator-focused features.

content.title: Rode VideoMic (~$100)
content.description: On-camera mic. Clean audio without complexity.

sections.title: Priority Order for Upgrades
content: 7. Accessories (only when you know what you need)

faq.question: Can I really start with just a phone?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Many million-subscriber channels started with phones. Content quality matters far more than video quality.

faq.question: What should I buy first?
faq.answer: Microphone. Bad audio makes viewers leave immediately. Upgrade audio before camera every time.

faq.question: When should I upgrade from phone?
faq.answer: After 50-100 videos, when you know your style and specific needs. Many successful creators never upgrade.

faq.question: Is webcam or phone better?
faq.answer: Modern phones are usually better than most webcams. Only high-end webcams (Elgato Facecam) beat good phones.
